register.description:
Current Source
Strength and trim control for current source. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description:
Adjust current from current source.
Output currents may be combined to get desired total current.

bitenum.token: 4.5 uA
bitenum.description: 4.5 uA

bitenum.token: 2.0 uA
bitenum.description: 2.0 uA

bitenum.token: 1.0 uA
bitenum.description: 1.0 uA

bitenum.token: 0.5 uA
bitenum.description: 0.5 uA

bitenum.token: No current connected
bitenum.description: No current connected

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Current source enable

register.description:
Comparator
Control COMPA and COMPB comparators. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Enables 400kohm resistance from COMPA reference node to ground. Used with COMPA_REF_CURR_EN to generate voltage reference for cap-sense.
Enables 2uA IPTAT current from ISRC to COMPA reference node. Requires ISRC.EN = 1. Used with COMPA_REF_RES_EN to generate voltage reference for cap-sense.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
COMPB enable
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
COMPA enable

register.description:
ADC Control 0
ADC Sample Control. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description:
ADC Sampling mode:
0: Synchronous mode 1: Asynchronous mode
The ADC does a sample-and-hold before conversion. In synchronous mode the sampling starts when the ADC clock detects a rising edge on the trigger signal. Jitter/uncertainty will be inferred in the detection if the trigger signal originates from a domain that is asynchronous to the ADC clock. SMPL_CYCLE_EXP determines the the duration of sampling. Conversion starts immediately after sampling ends.
In asynchronous mode the sampling is continuous when enabled. Sampling ends and conversion starts immediately with the rising edge of the trigger signal. Sampling restarts when the conversion has finished. Asynchronous mode is useful when it is important to avoid jitter in the sampling instant of an externally driven signal

Controls the sampling duration before conversion when the ADC is operated in synchronous mode (SMPL_MODE = 0). The setting has no effect in asynchronous mode. The sampling duration is given as 2^(SMPL_CYCLE_EXP + 1) / 6 us.

bitenum.token: 65536x 6 MHz clock periods = 10.9ms
bitenum.description: 65536x 6 MHz clock periods = 10.9ms

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Reset ADC digital subchip, active low. ADC must be reset every time it is reconfigured.
0: Reset 1: Normal operation

ADC Enable
0: Disable 1: Enable

register.description:
ADC Control 1
ADC Comparator Control. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description:
ADC Reference 0
Control reference used by the ADC. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Enable ADCREF in IDLE state.
0: Disabled in IDLE state 1: Enabled in IDLE state
Keep ADCREF enabled when ADC0.SMPL_MODE = 0. Recommendation: Enable ADCREF always when ADC0.SMPL_CYCLE_EXP is less than 0x6 (21.3us sampling time).
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

ADC reference source:
0: Fixed reference = 4.3V 1: Relative reference = VDDS
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

ADC reference module enable:
0: ADC reference module powered down 1: ADC reference module enabled

register.description:
ADC Reference 1
Control reference used by the ADC. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Trim output voltage of ADC fixed reference (64 steps, 2's complement). Applies only for ADCREF0.SRC = 0.
Examples: 0x00 - nominal voltage 1.43V 0x01 - nominal + 0.4% 1.435V 0x3F - nominal - 0.4% 1.425V 0x1F - maximum voltage 1.6V 0x20 - minimum voltage 1.3V
